syllabus:
**Intermediate Listening and Speaking - Spring 2022**

**Time:** Thursday, 10:20-12:10                    **Classroom:** 誠701A

**Objectives**: This course is designed to **cultivate student listening skills** on natural and real-life English, from a variety of sources like TV news, radio broadcasts, and simulated daily conversations. In so doing, there will be **a five-pronged approach** to the course:

**1)** Firstly, occasionally there will also be **supplementary materials**. These will vary over a range of areas and topics so that students can to familiarize themselves with the language spoken in various realistic settings while also discussing up-to date issues.  

**2)** Secondly, **the course textbook** is designed to improve listening comprehension skills for academic purposes while focusing on listening to general interest topics in English. There is also an **online lab** that dovetails with the book.

**3)** Thirdly, there will be **a task-based project** element to the course, whereby the student groups will be able to create **a class listening exercise**, and then teach it to the class.

**4)** Fourthly, there will also be **an online workshop** in the second half of the course whereby students will be asked to do an online course in English of their choice within their area of study or interest.

**5)** Finally, **Autonomous Listening Practice.** Students should **practice listening and speaking** outside of class every chance they get. Indeed, all significant English-language listening encounters should be recorded and handed in for grading in your portfolio.

**N.B. All five elements** to the course **will be evaluated and assessed** when calculating the final grade.

**Guidelines and Requirements: The Rules!**

Punctual attendance is required. Being on time is polite. **Talk to or email me** if you can’t attend class.

**Actively participate** in class discussions.

This is a **Flip Class**. **Homework must be done** for the class to work properly. This includes **reviewing** and **previewing** class chapters.

**All assignments** must be done and be **on time**.

**Smartphones**, tablets, etc, must be **turned off** unless needed in class.

**No eating** **or drinking** during class**.**

**Grading Policy****:** **The Business!**

**Final Grades** will be given based on student performances in these areas:

Attendance/Participation: 10%

Supplementary Classwork assignments (including Movie Review): 15%

Online lab exercises: 20%

Listening Teaching Task: 15%

MOOC Online Course Work: 15%

Autonomous Listening Practice: 15%

Final online Test: 10%
